This is another boss which requires you to basically spend act 1 preparing for it, just like Ironclad 1. However, I find it can often be countered with a boss swap. If you get an energy swap, you are less affected by Void turns, which is really important to staying ahead of the curve. But even if you don't get an energy from it, by the end of act 1, most boss swaps will be able to give you enough scaling value over time to have a high enough power level to take this boss on. Otherwise, it's really really punishing. The doomsday Dark orb means you have to have the scaling damage to kill it just like Hexaghost, while also hitting you really hard every 2 out of 3 turns. You can't just coast through act 1 like normal, hoping the elites drop enough good stuff to keep you alive. It's adapt or die.
Defect 1 is one side of the bullshit coin, the other side is Ironclad 1
One requires good value 1 and 2costs and good energy manipulation, the other requires good draw and status mitigation
~~or just <gelatinous cube>~~

Major consideration here is finding a safety rest near the end of act 1. You really want to make sure you can enter this fight with high health, because you can't really block sunder effectively, and the various artifact charges make it hard to apply weak. Offensive scaling also becomes pretty important because the dark orbs put you on a timer. Usually, if you are slanting your deck towards burst damage to take out act 1 eltes and hallway fights quickly, and take an extra rest or find a sustain relic, you should be fine. Just make sure to take whatever offensive scaling you can find, even if it's not ideal. You can consider taking energy generation to counter the voids, but I don't tend to find those kinds of cards to be good in act 1 generally. Taking one or two high value block cards can help, but again, is not ideal in act 1. Boss swapping can be viable to counter the voids, but I really don't like the high variance of boss swapping, and I tend to really like some of the smaller neow bonuses (common relic, extra souls, transform/upgrade)

One of the hardest act 1 bosses (I go back and forth between this and IC1 when I try and decide which one is harder), it hits like a truck, messes with your energy and draw, and doesn't allow you to stall it out thanks to the dark orbs. The dark orbs should never hit you, but they will always loom over you and make you fight faster.
A really overtuned and not that fun to fight boss, and there is no counterplay to the gimmick, as there are no cards nor relics that can exhaust the void before you draw it.
And yes it still takes your energy even if it gets <repulsor auto>

I dislike this fight a lot for those reasons. It's both hard and not really counterable, and the amount of decks that with 2 energy and 4 draw can block a 24 damage sunder is very limited in act 1.
the relic that draws on hp loss?
Yes
Ultimately the only way you will ever block the sunder is with some sort of blur, potion usage, or an infinite (buffer too)
Buffer?
that too sorry
and defensive mode is basically blur, before you say that,
I know
And all of these share one of 2 things in common. They are either already very strong mechanics, or are a limited resource.
It leads to too many situations where damage is unblockable, even with decks made to counter the boss, and that's no fun.
Overall the fight allows little counterplay to what it does, and what it does is hit you for a lot of damage.
With one exception: <Cleanse>
